comment: You would think "It' Wellness, easy gen ed course not too much stress", professor Ravenscraft grades so strict on everything writing. If those Healthy living check ins are not 100% how he likes it you will get an 80 every time. I spent so much time in this class more than necessary and ended with a 90.2. Barely. Way too stressful for gen ed.

The class itself is super easy, but he is such a harsh grader. This class is supposed to be an easy A, but he makes it hard to even get As on discussions, healthy living check-ins, anything. If you dont do the healthy living check-in exactly like he wants, have fun with a B.

David Ravenscraft... that is the name of a heavenly wellness teacher who strives his best to make you a wellness god. I took his hybrid wellness class and he made the class very easy. His lectures are funny and highly recommend for someone who wants an easy A and a good time.
Easy-going and understanding. Lenient with due dates at times, but don't take advantage. Enjoys his job.

A great person with a great personality that wants you to pass the class. A lot of the work is online, but I would still go to class because he explains what you're doing online. Overall, he was a fun guy to be around and always willing to talk to you if you need it.

Easy A. Chill class that always lets out early. All the work is online; Bearface. All lecture Poweroints are in Bearface software. I went a good amount of times to class and did fine. Lenient with deadlines.

Prof. Ravenscraft is an awesome guy! He has 2 other jobs and he still comes to class energized and he cares about his students. Most of the work is online, he even gives you all of the questions that are going to be on the midterm and final on the study guide. Easy A, go to class complete the work. Also if you have trouble with work ask him for help.

I am pretty sure he cancelled/ had a work day more times that we actually went to class. He's awesome. He always lets class out early too. If you want an easy A take this class. If you don't get a grade you want on something, he will let you try again. There is a midterm and final, but honestly they are super easy. He just wants you to pass.

He is the best. He did start taking attendance this semester, but going to class is entertaining. He's a very kind and hilarious man. Only a couple mandatory exercises, which you can sneak away and fake the answers online. Two tests, both online with the answers coming straight from the book. Easiest A ever.
Prof Ravenscraft was really chill and doesn't put a deadline for the wellness modules online. He is really understanding and funny! 10/10 recommend

Professor Ravenscraft is genuinely one of the nicest people I have ever met. Professors like him don't come often at public universities, he's so helpful and he actually cares about the student and wants you to pass. He will do everything he can to help you and goes out of his way to make things clear. I could not recommend his course enough

The Greatest teacher. All the work is online. You don't have to go to class, but his lectures and stories are still nice. Textbook was online, through the website you do your work. If you have any problems he will be there to listen. A wonderful professor.

Ravenscraft was a blessing to have. Attendance is not mandatory at all. The work is online, but his lectures does help if you want to hear someone go over it. He has interesting stories. Easy Grader. You'll love him from his syllabus day. Only got a B because I didnt complete a few assignments. He is very lenient.
Best class I ever had!!! take him

Go to class, it will pay off. Other than that, just do the assignments and be as thorough as possible. It's easy unless you make it hard. Ravenscraft is also super charismatic and has a great personality and does his best to make the class less boring than it is, he knows it's just a requirement. You won't regret taking him.
Attendance isn't mandatory. Very easy class. Do your work and you'll get an A. If you want to take a class where you don't have to stress out, then choose him.

He grades by the rubric, and the work is less than an hour of work per week. SO easy. He was nice, friendly, and very personable. He only used 30 minutes of 1.5 hr class time, and cancelled or allowed many days off. I really enjoyed his class. He was a decent professor, but a better person.
